element.name: Ardgillan I by Windsockers, Traditional Cache (1.5/2)

long-description.p: Ardgillan is a very well preserved castle near Skerries to the North of Dublin, surrounded by beautiful gardens and set in a great landscape. From the cache, you will have spectacular views over the grounds and over Skerries Bay and the Skerries town.A visit to the castle is highly recommended.
There are two ways to get to this cache: from the main car park at N 53 34.922 W 006 09.645, or the pedestrain route at the "Ladies Stairs" at N 53 35.473 W 006 09.365.

If you want to visit this cache using public transport, the bus route to take from Dublin City centre is the No. 33 which will drop you off at the "Ladies Stairs" on the road between Balbriggan and Skerries, the pedestrian entrance to the Demesne via a bridge which spans the road and railway line. Alternatively, you can take the 41 from Dublin City Centre to Swords, and then take the 33A (which from Swords on follows the same route as the 33).

p.b: Note that access to the grounds is open from 10am to 5pm in the Wintertime, and 10am to 9pm in the summer (June, July and August).

ul.li:
2010-06-11T19:00:00Z : Write note by Petr Skacha
TB drop.

2010-05-25T19:00:00Z : Found it by Trip52
More luck then skill used to find this one. (and it is a very good hiding spot) GeoCoin out, bouncy ball in. TFTC.

2010-05-04T19:00:00Z : Found it by Petr Skacha
We were here few times before it moved.Nice hiding Mr. Windsocker. TFTC

2010-05-03T19:00:00Z : Found it by niallk1234
Easy find, the second of 4 for today. Took a geocoin and left a geocoin. Thanks for the cache.

2010-04-16T20:30:25Z : Update Coordinates by Windsockers
** Coordinates Changed From ** N 53° 34.987 W 006° 09.560 Distance From Old: 48.5 feet or 14.8 meters Moving to new area due to tree felling

groundspeak:cache.groundspeak:name: Ardgillan I
groundspeak:cache.groundspeak:long_description:
Ardgillan is a very well preserved castle near Skerries to the North of Dublin, surrounded by beautiful gardens and set in a great landscape. From the cache, you will have spectacular views over the grounds and over Skerries Bay and the Skerries town.A visit to the castle is highly recommended.

There are two ways to get to this cache: from the main car park at N 53 34.922 W 006 09.645, or the pedestrain route at the "Ladies Stairs" at N 53 35.473 W 006 09.365.

If you want to visit this cache using public transport, the bus route to take from Dublin City centre is the No. 33 which will drop you off at the "Ladies Stairs" on the road between Balbriggan and Skerries, the pedestrian entrance to the Demesne via a bridge which spans the road and railway line. Alternatively, you can take the 41 from Dublin City Centre to Swords, and then take the 33A (which from Swords on follows the same route as the 33).

Note that access to the grounds is open from 10am to 5pm in the Wintertime, and 10am to 9pm in the summer (June, July and August).


The Windsockers
